com.mapdigit.gis.geometry

Class GeoLatLngBounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoBounds
      • com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoLatLngBounds

  • public class GeoLatLngBounds
extends GeoBounds
    GeoLatLngBounds is a bound in geographical coordinates longitude and latitude. Note: the positive of North is from top to bottom instead of from bottom to top internally.
    © Copyright 2009 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.mapdigit.gis.geometry.GeoBounds

        height, maxX, maxY, minX, minY, OUT_BOTTOM, OUT_LEFT, OUT_RIGHT, OUT_TOP, width, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeoLatLngBounds()
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose upper-left corner is at (0, 0) in the coordinate space, and whose width and height are both zero.
      GeoLatLngBounds(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose upper-left corner is specified as (x,y) and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name.
      GeoLatLngBounds(GeoLatLngBounds r)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds, initialized to match the values of the specified GeoBounds.
      GeoLatLngBounds(GeoLatLng sw, GeoLatLng ne)
      Constructs a rectangle from the points at its south-west and north-east corners.
      GeoLatLngBounds(GeoPoint p)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose upper-left corner is the specified GeoPoint, and whose width and height are both zero.
      GeoLatLngBounds(GeoPoint p, GeoSize size)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose upper-left corner is specified by the GeoPoint argument, and whose width and height are specified by the GeoSize argument.
      GeoLatLngBounds(GeoSize size)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose top left corner is (0, 0) and whose width and height are specified by the GeoSize argument.
      GeoLatLngBounds(int width, int height)
      Constructs a new GeoBounds whose upper-left corner is at (0, 0) in the coordinate space, and whose width and height are specified by the arguments of the same name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsBounds(GeoLatLngBounds other)
      Tests if the interior of the IShape entirely contains the specified rectangular area.
      boolean containsLatLng(GeoLatLng latlng)
      Returns true if the geographical coordinates of the point lie within this rectangle
      void extend(GeoLatLng latlng)
      Enlarges this rectangle such that it contains the given point.
      GeoLatLng getCenter()
      Returns the point at the center of the rectangle.
      GeoLatLng getNorthEast()
      Returns the point at the north-east corner of the rectangle.
      GeoLatLng getSouthWest()
      Returns the point at the south-west corner of the rectangle.
      boolean intersects(GeoLatLngBounds other)
      Tests if the interior of the IShape intersects the interior of a specified rectangular area.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this rectangle is empty.
      boolean isFullLat()
      Returns true if this rectangle extends from the south pole to the north pole.
      boolean isFullLng()
      Returns true if this rectangle extends fully around the earth in the longitude direction.
      GeoLatLng toSpan()
      Returns a GLatLng whose cordinates represent the size of this rectangle.

        Parameters:
        p - a GeoPoint that is the upper-left corner of the GeoBounds
